lugarp1: Being outdoors, seeing vegetation and the sky, feeling in touch with nature, are associated with high levels of emotional well-being.
lugarp2: For the exhibition Um lugar para estar, a virtual reality experience, a 3D printed sculpture, and a diptych of digital prints  are presented.
lugarp3: Um lugar para estar (2018–2019) introduces the notion of being present at a natural environment from a virtual environment — viewed in virtual reality. It's proposed that similar emotional effects be obtained between the natural and the virtual. Um lugar para estar can be visualized in two versions of sunlight incidence: daytime and nighttime.
lugarp4: The portion of geographic space used to build the virtual environment of Um lugar para estar is physically materialized into a 3D printed sculpture. Terreno (2019) proposes a notion to the spatial dimension of Um lugar para estar from a small scale, introducing a complete view of the geographical space of the virtual environment.
lugarp5: Incidência de luz em um ambiente virtual (2019) presents a diptych of two digital prints that figurated are presented. Printed on Foam, both two digital prints introduce the same portrait of the virtual environment of Um lugar para estar, differentiated by the incidence of simulated light on the virtual environment: daytime and nighttime.
tropical1: For the exhibition Paraíso, a film with a homonymous title and two works of direct relation to the film are presented.
tropical2: The film Paraíso (2017) records the artist Chiaki Mihara, in an environment of abundant nature, producing a painting that introduces a spatial rereading of the present Atlantic Forest scenery.
tropical3: Produced by Chiaki Mihara during the film Paraíso, the painting Mata Atlântica (2018) is presented framed in the exhibition.
tropical4: The painting Mata Atlântica was scanned in high resolution, originating a new work titled Mata Atlântica (Digital) (2018), projected on a large scale in the exhibition space.
mundoAberto1: The human brain's response to the perception and notion of an environment is primarily conceived and processed from the light, color, and texture present in a space.
mundoAberto2: For the exhibition Mundo Aberto, a virtual reality experience with a homonymous title of the exhibition, a 3D printed sculpture, and a digital print are presented.
mundoAberto3: Introduced in virtual reality, a planet digitally constructed, of total area with vast dimensions, is presented in Mundo Aberto (2017–2018). The experience in virtual reality  proposes to the viewer an exercise to the possibility of free autonomy in space. In Mundo Aberto, a notion of the spontaneity of action is built in a virtual environment.
mundoAberto4: Superfície de Mundo Aberto (2018) presents a 3D printed sculpture that embodies a cutout of the geographic space of Mundo Aberto.
mundoAberto5: Visão Aérea de Mundo Aberto (2018) introduces a digital print originated in the virtual environment of Mundo Aberto. Printed on Foam, the digital print figures the surface portion materialized in the 3D print of A Superfície de Mundo Aberto.
